abstract: Investors who own about $800 million worth of bonds issued by Residential Capital, the mortgage lending arm of Ally Financial, have formed a group to negotiate with the company, according to a press release.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

lead_paragraph: Investors who own about $800 million worth of secured bonds issued by Residential Capital, the mortgage lending arm of Ally Financial, have formed a group to negotiate with the company, according to a press release. The creditor group hired the law firm White & Case after becoming concerned that Ally might push Residential Capital into bankruptcy protection. Read more »
